alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Craven; Jones; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 17 at 9:19PM EST until December 17 at 9:45PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Jones County in eastern North Carolina... Central Craven County in eastern North Carolina... South central Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... West central Pamlico County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 945 PM EST. * At 918 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over River Bend, or near New Bern, moving north at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... New Bern, James City, Trent Woods, River Bend, Maysville, Vanceboro, Askins, Cayton, Jasper, Tuscarora, Rhems, Olympia, Ernul, Catfish Lake, Coastal Carolina Regional Airport, Bridgeton, and Pollocksville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for eastern North Carolina.
